definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Yes, many flying mounts are available, such as pegasus or griffins .
sentences.chinese: 有的，还有其他多种飞行坐骑，比如飞马和狮鹫。

sentences.english: Pegasus is a famous winged horse of ancient times .
sentences.chinese: 飞马是古代一匹有名的长着翅膀的马。

sentences.english: Flying high in the autumn sky is the mythical winged horse Pegasus.
sentences.chinese: 翱翔在秋季夜空中的是神话中的飞马星座。

sentences.english: The intension of Pegasus is to break with the image and appearance of current wheelchairs.
sentences.chinese: 飞马的内涵是要打破目前的形象和轮椅的外观。

sentences.english: Formidable hybrid of unicorn and Pegasus.
sentences.chinese: 独角兽和飞马令人生畏的混血。

definition: to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
celestial horse (mythology)/fine horse/Ferghana horse/(western mythology) Pegasus
Pang De (-219), general of Cao Wei at the start of the Three Kingdoms period, victor over Guan Yu 關羽|关羽/Pound (name)/Ezra Pound (1885-1972), American poet and translator
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
